results.title: Place in the sun
results.creator_credit: William Morrison, Stanley H. Bloom and University of Southern California. Dept. of Cinema
results.brief_description: Confident student docu-drama is a polemical work outlining the benefits of more liberal work farms over traditional prisons. Initial fictional sequence is a brooding and highly stylised play of light and shadow, the mood heightened further by Hoyt S. Curtin’s dramatic score. Revolves around the experiences of a young boy is caught by sheriff officers during an attempted burglury. Sentenced to a labour farm, he finds confident and sympathetic supervision and constructive activity that enables him to regain his self respect. In this ‘place in the sun’ there are no walls or any of the oppressiveness of prison atmosphere. The boy finds, instead, hard work, an opportunity to acquire useful skills, and the knowledge that he can become a useful member of society.

results.title: Place for a village
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Some unique sites are shown in this film, including the Russell Street Police Station, the Museum, the State Library, Government House, Captain Cook’s Cottage, Melbourne High and Grammar Schools, an Italian restaurant with a dinner and a show, the suburb of Toorak and the Holden GM factory. This film also opens to some aerial footage from the era of the inner city blocks. Commentary by Harry Dearth.

results.title: Pixote
results.creator_credit: Hector Babenco, Jose Pinto, Paulo Francini, Embrafilme, Paulo Francini Productions and Jose Pinto Productions
results.brief_description:
“During a routine police sweep of the squalid streets of Sao Paulo, Pixote, an abandoned 10-year-old boy, the effeminate Lilica and another youth are taken to a detention centre. The three boys escape, aided by Lilica’s lover, and get involved with a homosexual drug dealer and an aging alcoholic prostitute. The performances by actual street kids are horrifyingly natural.” Babenco’s film was one of the first to address the problem of Rio de Janeiro’s street kids, and with the combination of stark street images and symbolic imagery, the film plays out as a hallucinatory nightmare. A startling critique of third world conditions and societal indifference to the plight of individuals, in particular children, forced to live in appalling conditions. A child’s life crushed by economic depression, and an astounding performance from Fernando Ramos da Silva, make ‘Pixote’ an emotionally gut-wrenching film. Reference: Holt Foreign Film Guide.

Credits: Producer, Paulo Francini, Jose Pinto ; director, Hector Babenco ; writer, Hector Babenco, Jorge Duran ; photography, Rodolfo Sanches ; music, John Neschling ; editing, Luiz Elias.
Cast: Fernando Ramos da Silva, Jorge Juliao, Gilberto Moura, Marilia Pera, Jose Nilson dos Santos, Elke Maravilha, Jardel Filho.

results.title: Pixillation
results.creator_credit: Kenneth Knowlton, Lillian Schwartz and Perspective Films
results.brief_description: An experiment in film art using computer graphics and music by the Moog synthesiser. Inventive combinations of colour, form and motion have been produced. Music by Gershon Kingsley; crystal growth and computer graphics by Bell Labs.

results.title: Pixar: 20 years of animation [exhibition archive]
results.brief_description:
ACMI Screen Gallery Exhibition
28 June 2007 - 14 October 2007 (See Exhibition record ID: 30)
Pixar: 20 Years of Animation is the international exhibition that takes you behind the scenes of the studio that created Finding Nemo, Monsters, Inc., Toy Story, Cars and The Incredibles.
Over 500 sketches, paintings, sculptures and storyboards reveal how Pixar’s much-loved characters and worlds are brought to life. In addition to these one-of-a-kind works by artists and sculptors, the exhibition includes spectacular immersive environments and interactive experiences developed by Pixar to extend the magic of their films. more
The world’s largest exhibition dedicated to the art of animation comes from the Museum of Modern Art in New York, and makes its only Australian appearance at ACMI.

results.title: Pity me not = Without each other
results.creator_credit: Saul Swimmer, Allen Klein, III Task Pictures and PMN Productions
results.brief_description: A drama about circus life and those who are a part of the circus family - in particular, a young trapeze artist played by Tony Anthony. Cast also includes Brud Talbot, Anne Hegira, Michael Dunn, Bob White, Barbara Biggart, Ann Harris. Music composed and conducted by Dimitri Tiomkin.

results.title: Pitjiri: the snake that will not sink
results.creator_credit: Karen Hughes and Trikon Film Corporation
results.brief_description: In 1936 on a remote outpost in the Northern Territory, nine aboriginal elders appeared before Ruth Heathcock, a young white nurse who they believed was a member of their tribe before the Dreaming. What she later experienced in her healing work is the subject of this extraordinary documentary. A multi-award winning production.
results.title_for_label: Pitjiri: the snake that will not sink
results.description: In 1936 on a remote outpost in the Northern Territory, nine aboriginal elders appeared before Ruth Heathcock, a young white nurse who they believed was a member of their tribe before the Dreaming. results.title: Pitcha this : youth telling stories : Digital Storytelling project
results.creator_credit: Teialah Mason, Simone Andy, Rebecca Phillips, Nikki Butler, Lionel Austin, Kalimna Andy, Jade Colgan, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Seven Indigenous youth tell their own stories about who they are and where they come from. They proudly describe the places and people that inspire them and connect them to their heritage. In doing so, they provide an examination of what it is to grow up Indigenous in Australia in the 1990s, how to engage with your spirituality and identity today.
results.title_for_label: Pitcha this : youth telling stories : Digital Storytelling project
results.creator_credit_for_label: Teialah Mason, Simone Andy, Rebecca Phillips, Nikki Butler, Lionel Austin, Kalimna Andy, Jade Colgan, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Pitcha this : Stories from the windy wanderers : Digital Storytelling workshop
results.brief_description: Nine stories from members of the Indigenous community in Heywood in south-western Victoria. The stories, while providing an insight into the treatment of Indigenous people in Australia, are mostly personal accounts of what it is that keeps these particular people spiritually connected, whether it be the land or the people they love.
